column5: Well, my buds and I took the day off work yesterday and headed to Gilford to do a little perch fishing.  We booked a hut with Terry Goy( Blue Huts )and were doing quite well first thing in the morning with lots of bites a couple dozen perch iced within the first hour or two.  My favorite presentation took most of the morning's catch.   The bite slowed to a trickle and for several hours we had nothing.. zip.. nadda.  We wondered if they had moved on, developed lock-jaw or perhaps a pike had come by for a visit.  Well, we soon had our answer when my little St. Croix perch stick almost bends in two and reel starts to scream with a sizeable fish on!  After a couple runs, I coax him to the hole and my buds an I see Mr. Pike.  He takes one look at us and starts another run and my heart is in my throat.  After bringing him back to the hole( which seemed way too small )and gently lifting his head upwards, I see my little #2 jigging Rap hooked on the edge of it's mouth and luckly none of my 3 1/2 pound Berkeley Micro Ice mono had come near his teeth.  Reaching down the hole, I placed my hand under it's gill plate and hauled him out.   Well, that just made our trip.  I'll leave you with a few of my favorite images from this winter's Gilford outings.  Snowmobilers.   Goodtimes.   Anyone Hungry?   The Fridge.   The Gathering.   Sunrise.
beauty pike!
SWEET!!!  Great job landing that monster!  Congrats on a great catch!
Nice Pike Did you weigh her or just sent her back down the hole quickly
Great job landing that beauty for sure!  God knows I'd have screwed that up about a dozen times.  Really nice scenery pics too.
Thats a really nice pike great pictures  rob
Nice pike !! What are those two white, round shaped objects beside the hole? Were you trying to catch fisherman?
Can't say I'd fear a big old slimer like that! Nice one!
Great report Mike.  That's a beauty pike !!!  Gotta love those jigging raps eh !!
Very Nice!
very nice looking pike. Looks like a great day!
Nice cook's bay PIKE!
Nice Fish!!
Good thing you were not fishing out of a 6 inch hole, at least you were able to land 'im.
Great job.....nice pike there.
more like a drean come true than a fear

Ya, the fear part comes from trying to land a pike on perch gear.  I know it happens to a lot of guys who like perching and you hold your breath when Mr. Pike grabs on and you hope that everything just works out.  I know it was the largest fish I landed on the lightest line( 3 1/2 pound test )which is where the fear part came in.  LOL  Thanks for the comments!
Nice pike.  Does a person need some type of license to serve food on the ice? I'd be a little concerned with the sanitary conditions with them not having running water to wash their hands & what not.
Hah hah hah!  Our thoughts exactly Zib!  I dunno and don't want to dash anyone's entrepreneurial spirit but we just ate the sandwiches we packed ourselves.
That is one beauty Pike. That would be a thrill to get over the tap, tap of Perch. WTG
nice pike,congrats
Nice catch !!!!...great fishing trip pictures as well...cheers
Nice fish!!
